messages.message:
Correct, many of these services do not use k8s as they are straightforward client/server pairs. The ones that are more complicated are things like stats scraping (prometheus/vmagent, loki) which depend on things like service discovery plugins of k8s. We will have to rewrite a bunch of configs here. Another caveat is that some of the stats / dashboards also assume a k8s runtime and may not be very helpful too (ex: queries written in a way that depends on it). This is also true for mesh manager / DM also btw -- which I assume are also not deployed/tested in crafting sandboxes.

I am also inclined to think how much lift is there to standardize crafting deployment with rest of the bundles we publish today.
DM is deployed, in limited mode. It doesn't manage deployments, but is available for dynamic k8s workloads. Mesh manager is not, for the reasons you gave.
